intro: Echinopsis pecheretiana, commonly known as the Pechera's cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its short, columnar stem and clusters of white to pale pink flowers that bloom at night. The plant has a spiny exterior, with areoles that bear both spines and flowers. It is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Echinopsis pecheretiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and nocturnal flowering habit.
